Users DocumentÔÉÅ

This section is meant for users of the PCHEM Service, who are programmers and call PCHEM APIs within their python script to interact with Propsim.
Examples
You can refer to and edit / build on sample_experiment.py within the examples directory.
You can also call apis interactively, by running pchem_interactive, located within the examples directory.
WorkFlow

  1. Import the client pchem module as follows: from pchem import client as pchem_client

  2. Open or edit an emulation file: Open a pre-loaded scenario file by calling the open_emulation(<filename>). You can also call edit_emulation(<filename>) if you want to change the center frequency or other parameters.

  3. Start the emulation: Call start_emulation() or start_emulation_after_edit().

  4. Edit channel attenuation as desired, by calling set_output_gain(<channel_number>, <db_gain>), e.g. to replay recorded measurements or as per the position of radio nodes, controlled by another user-defined script.

  5. Stop the emulation: Call close_emulation().

You can refer to the APIs section for a list of all implemented apis and to the Developers section to contribute new apis.
